metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9013 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Django 1.8.x before 1.8.16, 1.9.x before 1.9.11, and 1.10.x before 1.10.3use a hardcoded password for a temporary database user created when runningtests with an Oracle database, which makes it easier for remote attackersto obtain access to the database server by leveraging failure to manuallyspecify a password in the database settings TEST dictionary.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9013` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
python-django-common - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
python3-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4').
